image.altText: The Victoria Police insignia on the sleeve of an officer's shirt.

props.synopsis: Police are alerting hundreds of accused sexual offenders that their cases may be compromised by the work of a digital forensics officer based in Bendigo.

title.children: Hundreds of Victorian sex crime cases being re-examined by police

image.altText: Close up photo of a woman

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old Shepparton woman has been jailed for 13 years after dousing another woman with petrol and setting her on fire during a dispute over an e-scooter.Â

title.children: Woman jailed for 13 years for setting rival alight in e-scooter fight

image.altText: a domed camera is mounted on a street sign

props.synopsis: The City of Melbourne is set to vote on a new plan that would see more privately owned CCTV cameras feeding into the city's security network and staff able to access the footage to investigate local law breaches.

title.children: Melbourne council staff to be given surveillance powers under draft plans

image.altText: Medicinal cannabis plantations close up.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man found guilty of insider trading during a $20 million capital raise by a medicinal cannabis company has been ordered to pay more than $225,000.

title.children: Man sentenced, fined over medicinal cannabis company insider trading

image.altText: Geelong Cats players run through the banner at the AFL grand final.

props.synopsis: The AFL fines Geelong $77,500 for failing to disclose third-party agreements with players over a six-year period.

title.children: Geelong Cats fined by AFL over third-party disclosures

image.altText: A man in an orange robe and red beanie arriving at court.

props.synopsis: The head monk of a Buddhist temple, Naotunne Vijitha, has denied sexually assaulting six girls at the temple in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Buddhist monk sexually assaulted girls at Melbourne temple, trial told

image.altText: A render of a proposed 17-storey community and affordable housing tower in Greensborough,

props.synopsis: A Victorian housing charity awarded more than $200 million in taxpayer funds for a proposed 17-storey tower is controlled by a for-profit investment firm, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Charity run by investment firm linked to 17-storey suburban tower

image.altText: A group of four parents standing in front of a brick building

props.synopsis: Parents of children with disability can miss out on social support, but a Victorian physiotherapist hopes to change that.

title.children: Social group helping parents of kids with disability find connection

image.altText: A billboard graffitied with glory to Hamas in black paint.

props.synopsis: Political leaders have condemned the painting of a pro-Hamas slogan on a Melbourne billboard as Australia's Jewish community commemorates the October 7 terrorist attack.

title.children: Pro-Hamas graffiti condemned as Australian Jewish community marks October 7

image.altText: Darcy Vescio of Carlton poses for a photo, holding the football to her chest

props.synopsis: Inaugural Carlton AFLW star Darcy Vescio has urged players to be more conscious of their role-model status when dressing up for end-of-season celebrations.

title.children: AFLW star says 'punching down' on Mad Monday must end

image.altText: An underground rail station.

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan says Melbourne's Metro Tunnel, which has been plagued by delays and cost blowouts, will open before Christmas, with construction of the final two stations now complete.

title.children: Melbourne Metro Tunnel to open in early December

image.altText: Nick Daicos of the Magpies celebrates a goal, yelling and punching his fist in the air

props.synopsis: The reported attempts to lure Nick Daicos away from Collingwood have headlined the second day of the AFL trade period. Look back at how all the day's trade news unfolded in our blog.

title.children: Rivals reportedly launch bid to lure Nick Daicos from Collingwood

image.altText: A woman holding an AFP report into the sovereign citizen movement while looking at the Facebook login screen

props.synopsis: A man who says he was threatened after investigating sovereign citizens says the movement should be labelled a terrorist organisation, but an academic argues this could lead to more violence.

title.children: Doxed man petitions to have sovereign citizens declared domestic terrorists

image.altText: What looks like an authentic Victorian drivers licence with the name Stuart Parker and a Ramsay Street address.

props.synopsis: Neighbours fans rush to Melbourne op shops after 40 years of props, furniture and Ramsay Street relics were donated to charities.

title.children: 'It's a storyline from Neighbours': Op shops serve up a slice of TV history

image.altText: A man with only one eye stands next to a woman with blonde hair.

props.synopsis: A young father who lost his eye after contracting a rare infection is suing the hospital that treated him, alleging it ignored his requests to investigate his condition properly.Â

title.children: 'I feel like I'm dying': Father loses eye after hospital's delayed diagnosis

image.altText: A composite image of Megan Fox, Joshua Elmes, Alicia Montebello and Lucus Garzoli

props.synopsis: A coroner determines that the sole survivor of a crash that killed four people at Bochara was behind the wheel during the incident.

title.children: Coroner's warning on crash that killed adult and three teens

image.altText: Jaffles on a tray covered in sugar, with milk and coffee.

props.synopsis: An oatmeal-filled jaffle made by a Melbourne food stylist and flavoured with Bundaberg Rum and bananas wins over judges in Scotland.

title.children: Australian woman wins World Porridge Making Championship in Scotland

image.altText: A prison fence and security camera

props.synopsis: Victoria's prison population has surged by 62 per cent in the last 20 years as the number of accused held on remand triples.

title.children: Rise in Victoria's prisoner numbers outpaces population growth

image.altText: An adult whale and a whale calf breaching.

props.synopsis: Once hunted almost to extinction, the population of humpback whales currently migrating down Australia's east coast has bounced back and is now greater than before whaling.

title.children: These whales were hunted to 150 individuals. Now there's 50,000 of them

image.altText: a man in a dark jacket walks through a brown crop

props.synopsis: We've been spraying it on our farms, gardens and roadsides for 50 years, but the world's most used weedkiller is starting to run out of steam.

title.children: German chemical giant to release Roundup alternative in Australia

image.altText: Optus sign in front of a building

props.synopsis: Optus customers have come forward to report more cases of triple-0 calls failing outside the embattled telcos previously admitted outages.

title.children: Optus customers left angry after more failed triple-0 calls

image.altText: A Facebook post written by Isla Bell's mother with a photo of Isla smiling underneath

props.synopsis: The body of Melbourne woman Isla Bell was so badly damaged that forensic experts were unable to say how she died, a court has been told.

title.children: Forensic pathologist unable to say how 19-year-old Isla Bell died

image.altText: tony stands in house

props.synopsis: More than a dozen customers of MJ Harris Group have told the ABC they have been left significantly out of pocket after the company went into liquidationÂ this week.

title.children: Clients of Melbourne builder lose life savings as company goes bust

image.altText: Erin Patterson with glasses on and head down gets into a van outside court

props.synopsis: Victoria's Director of Public Prosecutions will appeal the sentence handed down to convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson.

title.children: Prosecutors to appeal 'manifestly inadequate' sentence for Erin Patterson

image.altText: Snow covered Mount Bogong

props.synopsis:
Locals in Victoria's High Country are warning visitors about the unpredictable conditions in the alpine region, after the bodies of two women were discovered near Falls Creek.

Â

title.children: Dead hikers yet to be identified as locals warn of High Country danger

image.altText: A bus sitting at an angle on the side of a road after driving down an embankment

props.synopsis: A V/Line bus carrying a number of passengers plunges down an embankment in Victoria's south east, prompting a high-angle rescue.

title.children: Passengers rescued after V/Line bus crashes down embankment

image.altText: Essendon captain Zach Merrett stands in the race looking up as he waits to leads his team out at Carrara.

props.synopsis: Essendon once again firmly states that captain Zach Merrett will not leave the Bombers as all 18 clubs begin the wheeling and dealing on the first day of the AFL's trade period.

title.children: Bombers put their foot down in Zach Merrett saga on opening day of trade period

image.altText: A photo of people wearing black shirts with prints, holding protest signs, photos and flowers

props.synopsis: Around 600 people attend a justice march for Kaiden Morgan-Johnston, who died after he was allegedly stabbed while walking to a friend's house in Morwell.

title.children: Community unites to demand justice for beloved Aboriginal dancer

image.altText: A bearded man in a sports jersey stands with his arms folded in a country area.

props.synopsis: A council in Victoria's east tells volunteer groups it will no longer pay for their insurance policies, sparking community concerns and raising questions as to whose responsibility it should be.

title.children: Volunteer groups told to cover insurance costs on Crown land

image.altText: Bread, jam, biscuits, dip, muesli bars and sausages on a white background.

props.synopsis: The main ingredient in dozens of supermarket products has been reduced, an ABC investigation has found, leading retail and marketing experts to call for more transparency around recipe changes.

title.children: Why you might be paying more for reduced quality at the supermarket

image.altText: A composite image of two boys, one in a white shirt and one in a collared shirt and dark puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: A court case into the alleged murder of an 18-year-old last year reveals a connection to the fatal attacks on Chol Achiek, 12, and Dau Akueng, 15, on September 6.Â

title.children: Teen accused over fatal stabbing in Melbourne had history of offending, court hears

image.altText: Ryan Papenhuyzen lies with his face in the grass during the NRL grand final.

props.synopsis: The new and infinitely more exciting Melbourne Storm are finding out just how hard it is to play their exciting brand of footy when the tension is at its peak.

title.children: The Storm seem to make grand finals for fun, but winning is just out of reach

image.altText: A man wearing dark blue police uniform

props.synopsis: While Premier Jacinta Allan narrows in on machetes and bail laws, Chief Commissioner Mike Bush is looking to broader horizons as Victoria witnesses record levels of offending.

title.children: Victoria's police chief is forging his own path to fight record crime

image.altText: A pothole on a road in the foreground and three cars drive in the background  on roads.

props.synopsis: New data obtained by the ABC under Freedom of Information laws show the majority of claims for compensation by drivers encountering hazards on Victorian roads are being rejected.

title.children: Just 1 per cent of state's road damage compensation claims approved
